questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: Please write the ward name if it is not available on the list:

questions.text: E. Does the respondent identify as a person with a disability?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP1. Do you intend / want to vote at the upcoming election?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP1a. If no, why?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP2. Do you know where your polling station will be located?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP3. Do you expect to mark your own paper?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP4. Do you expect to require assistance to vote?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP5. Do you expect to experience intimidation when you vote?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP6. Do you think you will be able to vote in secret?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP7. Do you think candidates (or their supporters) will be able to find out who you will vote for?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP8. Do you want candidates (or their supporters) to know who you voted for?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP8a. Please provide reason why:
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP9. Should people with disabilities be given priority to vote first?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP10. Does your community ensure people with disabilities are given priority to vote (can vote first)?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP11. Was an electoral roll update done in you ward in 2022?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.tip: If respondent say 'yes: other', please tick the 'other' option and write where the electoral rolls publicly displayed
questions.text: CP12. Were the electoral rolls publicly displayed in your ward or district for verification?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP12a. If yes, did you check that your name was on the electoral roll?
questions.dependentQuestionAnswer: Yes: In Ward|Yes: In District|Yes: Other
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP13. How confident are you that your name will be on the roll on election day?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP14. Do you know anyone who was unable to register?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP14a. If yes, do you know why?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP15. Did anyone offer you an inducement to register?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP16. Are you aware there is an online PNG Roll Lookup 2022 application?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP16a. If yes, did you check your enrolment using PNG Roll Lookup 2022 application?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP17. Did you attend any face-to-face voter education awareness?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP17a. If yes, who conducted this awareness? (multiple responses permitted)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP18. Have you seen any PNGEC media? (multiple responses permitted)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP19. Are you concerned about COVID-19 in the context of this election?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP20. Please explain:
questions.dependentQuestionAnswer: Not at all|A little|Very concerned|Don't know
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP21. Have you done anything to protect yourself from COVID-19? (multiple responses permitted)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP22. Have any of the following conducted COVID-19 awareness? Check box if yes.
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP22a. If yes, what was the main message(s)?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP23. Do you have regular access to a mobile phone?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP23a. If yes, which of the following do you regularly use a mobile phone for?
questions.dependentQuestionAnswer: Yes – I own a phone|Yes – I have access to a phone
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP24. Have you accessed information about the election via a mobile phone?
questions.dependentQuestionAnswer: Yes – I own a phone|Yes – I have access to a phone
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP25. Have you received any campaign SMS messages?
questions.dependentQuestionAnswer: Yes – I own a phone|Yes – I have access to a phone
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP26. Are you part of any WhatsApp or Telegram groups?
questions.dependentQuestionAnswer: Yes – I own a phone|Yes – I have access to a phone
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP26a. If yes, have the elections or electoral politics been discussed in these groups?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP27. Has any candidate (or agent) contacted you by mobile phone in the lead up to the election?
questions.dependentQuestionAnswer: Yes – I own a phone|Yes – I have access to a phone
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP28. Have you joined in social media discussions about the election? (multiple responses permitted)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP29. Do mobile phones improve lives or cause trouble?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP29a. Why?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP30. Do you think women should vote separately from men?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP30a. Why?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP31. Do you think there should be more women MPs?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP32. Would you vote for a woman candidate?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP33. Are any good women candidates contesting this electorate?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP34. Do you support reserved seats for women in national parliament?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP35. Have you received gifts from any candidates/agents wanting your vote?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP35a. If yes, describe:
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP36. Have you received any cash from any candidates/agents wanting your vote?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP36a. If yes, how much from all candidates? (enter value in Kina)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP37. How does your economic situation compare to 2017?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP38. Are govt. services better, the same or worse than 2017?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP39. Is your local school better, same or worse since than 2017?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP40. Is your closest health clinic better, same or worse than 2017?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP41. Are roads in your electorate better, same or worse than 2017?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP42. What are the main challenges for you/your community now? (First main challenges)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP42. What are the main challenges for you/your community now? (Second main challenges)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP42. What are the main challenges for you/your community now? (Third main challenges)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP43. If you require funds for a personal need, who do you go to? (First answer)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP43. If you require funds for a personal need, who do you go to? (Second answer)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP43. If you require funds for a personal need, who do you go to? (Third answer)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP44. If your community requires funds, who do you go to? (first answer)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP44. If your community requires funds, who do you go to? (second answer)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP44. If your community requires funds, who do you go to? (third answer)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP45. Has DSIP funding improved service delivery for your ward?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP46. Tell us about any major DSIP/DDA projects that have benefited your ward since 2017? (First major project)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP46. Tell us about any major DSIP/DDA projects that have benefited your ward since 2017? (Second major project)
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP46. Tell us about any major DSIP/DDA projects that have benefited your ward since 2017? ((please add more major projects, if applicable))
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP47. How much does DSIP/DDA spending influence how people in your ward decide who to vote for?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP48. In 2019, the people of Bougainville voted strongly for independence from PNG.  Do you think the PNG government should grant them independence?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP49. What would the consequences of an independent Bougainville be for you?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP50. What would an independent Bougainville mean for PNG?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP51. Based on recommendations from the Electoral Boundaries Commission, Parliament has created seven new open electorates for the 2022 election…  Were you aware of this?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP52. Do you think further changes to electoral boundaries are needed?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.text: CP52a. Why?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 7: Citizen Survey - Campaign Period

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.text: PP17b. If received, did you ask for the cash received?
questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questions.text: PP36. Some people believe MPs should be debating policy and making laws, while others think they should be delivering services and bringing development to their electorate…  What should be your MP’s main job? (MR)

questions.path: Citizen survey/citizen survey/Section 11: Citizen Survey - Post Polling

questionOptions.text: Yes – I have access to a phone
Promoting or opposing national policy / laws
Focus on national issues and Ministries
